Name: ventilation pneumonitis
Definition: An extrinsic allergic alveolitis caused by inhalation of antigens from thermophilic actinomycetes species growing in air conditioners and humidifiers. Fungi like Aureobasidium sp and Candida albicans that survive in the contaminated water in humidifiers and air conditioners are also known to cause the disease.

Name: bagassosis
Definition: An extrinsic allergic alveolitis that is an industrial disease characterized by cough

Name: bird fancier's lung
Definition: An extrinsic allergic alveolitis which is caused by inhalation of antigens from avian excreta. The disease has_symptom abrupt onset of dyspnea

Name: farmer's lung
Definition: An extrinsic allergic alveolitis which is induced by the inhalation of spores (Aspergillus sp and thermophilic actinomycetes) in dust from moldy hay or straw. It is characterized by sudden onset

Name: malt worker's lung
Definition: An extrinsic allergic alveolitis which is caused by inhalation of fungal spores of Aspergillus clavatus and Aspergillus fumigatus from moldy barley.

Name: mushroom workers' lung
Definition: An extrinsic allergic alveolitis involving inflammation of the alveoli within the lung caused by hypersensitivity to the inhalation of organic dust particles derived from either the mushrooms

Name: sick building syndrome
Definition: An extrinsic allergic alveolitis that is characterized by a set of symptoms such as headache

Name: cork-handlers' disease
Definition: An extrinsic allergic alveolitis caused by inhalation of cork dust containing the antigens produced by the fungus Penicillium glabrum. The symptoms include dyspnea
